title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman are uncertain for the Bruins' game against the Blue Jackets on Thursday.
McAvoy and Swayman celebrated Team USA's Olympic gold in men's hockey and attended Trump's State of the Union.
Boston Bruins currently hold the final playoff spot in the Eastern Conference with a 32-20-5 record.

title: Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots could target 37-year-old free agent Trent Williams to strengthen offensive line.
San Francisco 49ers and Trent Williams struggle to agree on a new contract.
Williams would be among the top free-agent tackles, potentially filling a need for the Patriots.

title: Boston ends snow emergency parking ban; residents can use space savers until Thursday evening
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston lifted the snow emergency and parking ban at 6 p.m. Tuesday after 17 inches of snow fell.
Residents must remove vehicles from discounted garages by 8 p.m. or face regular rates, per Mayor Wu's office.
Space savers can be used until 6 p.m. Thursday, except in South End or Bay Village, before removal.

title: With more than 60 inches of snow this year, will the city dump its snow into Boston Harbor?
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston will use 14 snow farms to manage and melt accumulated snow, not dumping it into Boston Harbor.
Mayor Michelle Wu's office confirms 4,620 cubic yards of snow removed following this week's blizzard.
Massachusetts banned snow dumping in the harbor in 1997, except for emergencies; current measures suffice.

title: Yes, it’s true: Dunkin’ is selling iced coffee in 48-ounce buckets
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Dunkin' is testing 48-ounce iced coffee buckets with handles at select locations in New England for a limited time.
The coffee buckets, priced from $8.89, are available for iced coffees, lattes, and refreshers.
Exact locations for the bucket availability remain unconfirmed despite social media sightings and reports from some Massachusetts and New Hampshire stores.

title: What Raiders GM John Spytek said about Maxx Crosby trade rumors
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Raiders GM John Spytek expects Maxx Crosby to stay despite trade rumors following a 3-14 season.
Crosby underwent surgery for a torn meniscus; Spytek maintains a strong relationship with the five-time Pro Bowler.
Spytek did not label Crosby as untradeable, stating he remains open to offers, according to ESPN.

title: Platner maintains big lead over Mills in Maine senate race, new poll finds
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Graham Platner leads Maine Gov. Janet Mills 64% to 26% in Democratic Senate primary, per a UNH poll.
Platner leads Republican Sen. Susan Collins 49% to 38% in a hypothetical general election matchup.
Despite past controversies, Platner retains 71% favorability among likely Democratic voters, with strong support from progressives.

title: R.I. college student dies of carbon monoxide poisoning while charging cellphone in car
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Joseph Boutros, 21, died from carbon monoxide poisoning while charging his phone inside a snow-covered car in Newport, R.I.
A nor'easter caused the vehicle's exhaust pipe to be embedded in snow, leading to accidental CO poisoning, Newport police said.
Salve Regina University mourns Boutros, a Class of 2026 student and football player from Bohemia, New York.

title: Mass. hiker suffering medical emergency rescued from White Mountains
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 75-year-old hiker from Acton experiencing a medical emergency was rescued from Zealand Hut in White Mountain National Forest.
The New Hampshire Fish and Game Department responded at 2 a.m. Sunday, assisting the hiker down the trail with snowmobile support.
The hiker was transported to Littleton Regional Hospital after being taken 2.2 miles to Route 3 for further treatment.

title: Man arrested for allegedly throwing dog off balcony while drunk in Milford
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A Milford man, Alex De Oliveira, was arrested for allegedly throwing a dog off a balcony while intoxicated.
The incident occurred at Oak Ridge Apartments; police found the severely injured dog partially buried in snow.
De Oliveira was charged with animal cruelty, disturbing the peace, and vandalizing property; released on $5,000 bail.
